# Stacked densities {.unnumbered} ::: {.callout-tip appearance='simple' icon=false} ***This graph is largely complete and just needs final proof reading.*** ::: :::: {.callout-note collapse="false" icon=false} ## Graph info ::: {style="font-size: 1.25em; color: #007bff;"} **Should I use this graph?** :::
::: {.cell layout-align="right"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](stacked_filled_density_graphs_files/figure-html/full_code_display-1.png){fig-align='right' width=60% height=60%} ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.10em; color: #007bff;"} **This graph requires:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #fa7b3c;"} **✅ a categorical variable** ::: :::: ## Description Density graphs are typically used to visualize the distribution of a single variable, but stacked density graphs are great for visualizing how proportions vary across numeric (continuous) variables. ## Getting set up :::: {.panel-tabset} ### Packages ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **PACKAGES:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} Install packages. ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} install.packages("palmerpenguins") library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) ``` ::: ::: ### Data ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **DATA:** ::: ::: {.column-margin} ![Artwork by @allison_horst](../www/lter_penguins.png){fig-align="right" width="100%" height="100%"} ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} Remove missing `sex` from the `penguins` data ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} peng_density <- dplyr::filter(palmerpenguins::penguins, !is.na(sex)) dplyr::glimpse(peng_density) #> Rows: 333 #> Columns: 8 #> $ species Adelie, Adelie, Adelie, Adelie, … #> $ island Torgersen, Torgersen, Torgersen,… #> $ bill_length_mm 39.1, 39.5, 40.3, 36.7, 39.3, 38… #> $ bill_depth_mm 18.7, 17.4, 18.0, 19.3, 20.6, 17… #> $ flipper_length_mm 181, 186, 195, 193, 190, 181, 19… #> $ body_mass_g 3750, 3800, 3250, 3450, 3650, 36… #> $ sex male, female, female, female, ma… #> $ year 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 20… ``` ::: ::: :::: ## The grammar :::: {.panel-tabset} ### Code ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **CODE:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} Create labels with `labs()` Initialize the graph with `ggplot()` and provide `data` Map the `flipper_length_mm` to the `x` and add `after_stat(count)` Map `sex` to `fill` *Inside* the `geom_density()` function, set `position` to `"fill"` ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} labs_fill_density <- labs( title = "Adult foraging penguins", x = "Flipper length (mm)", fill = "Sex") ggp2_fill_density <- ggplot(data = peng_density, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, after_stat(count), fill = sex)) + geom_density(position = "fill") ggp2_fill_density + labs_fill_density ``` ::: ::: ### Graph ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **GRAPH:** ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](stacked_filled_density_graphs_files/figure-html/create_graph_fill_density-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: ::::
